enhanced_by.reason: Both methods are part of the standard Object class contract and are often tested together to ensure consistent behavior.
The toString method can provide additional context about the object's state, which can be useful for setting up tests for the equals method.
The hashCode method is often used to verify that two objects that are equal have the same hash code, which is a common assertion in tests for the equals method.
The toString method can provide additional context about the object's state, which can be useful for verifying the behavior of the equals method.
